refnamediv.refpurpose: returns an entity object created from an XML document

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This parses the argument, which is expected to be a well formed XML fragment and returns a parse tree as a special memory-resident object. While xper_doc creates some disk-resident data structure, xtree_doc() will work faster but it may require more memory. You may wish to use xtree_doc for small documents (e.g. less than 5 megabytes and xper_doc for larger documents.

refsect2.title: document
refsect2.para: well formed XML or HTML document

refsect2.title: parser_mode
refsect2.para: 0, 1 or 2; 0 - XML parser mode, 1 - HTML parser mode, 2 - 'dirty HTML' mode (with quiet recovery after any syntax error)

refsect2.title: base_uri
refsect2.para: in HTML parser mode change all absolute references to relative from given base_uri (http://<host>:<port>/<path>)

refsect2.title: content_encoding
refsect2.para: string with content encoding type of <document>; valid are 'ASCII', 'ISO', 'UTF8', 'ISO8859-1', 'LATIN-1' etc., defaults are 'UTF-8' for XML mode and 'LATIN-1' for HTML mode.

refsect2.title: content_language
refsect2.para: string with language tag of content of <document>; valid names are listed in IETF RFC 1766, default is 'x-any' (it means 'mix of words from various human languages')

refsect2.title: dtd_validator_config
refsect2.para: configuration string for DTD validator, default is empty string meaning that DTD validator should be fully disabled. See Configuration Options of the DTD Validator for details.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: XML entity with underlying parse tree of source document; the tree will be a memory-resident structure of nested heterogeneous vectors.
